name: The Asia Pacific War
description: This course examines the Second World War in the Asia Pacific region and highlights: (1) how imperialism and colonialism of both the Euro-American and Japanese varieties were central to the War's outbreak, conduct, and â€œresolutionâ€; (2) various â€œlocalâ€ rather than simply national experiences and memories of the War, including those of marginalized groups in Japan and its colonies, â€œcomfort women,â€ victims of war atrocities, Asian North Americans, African Americans, and Pacific Islanders.
